ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How concerned are you about the COVID-19 pandemic?
Notes: 1=Very slightly or not at all; 2=A little; 3=Moderately;  4=Quite a bit; 5=Extremely

ElementDescription: Has COVID-19: Made you concerned about your own health?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Has COVID-19: Made you concerned about spreading the virus to at-risk family or friends?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Has COVID-19: Changed how you conduct your social life?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Has COVID-19: Changed how often you see your friends?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Has COVID-19: Changed how often you go to bars?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Has COVID-19: Changed how often you go to restaurants?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Has COVID-19: Changed how often you drink alcohol?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Has COVID-19: Changed how much you drink when you do drink alcohol?
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: You drink more often than usual
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: You drink less often than usual
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: You drink at different times than you normally would
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: You drink a different type of alcohol than usual
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: You drink in a different place than typical
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: You drink alone or with fewer people than usual
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: It hasn't affected how often I drink
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Has COVID-19 changed how much you drink when you do drink alcohol?
Notes: 1=I drink a lot less; 2=I drink a little less; 3=I drink the same amount; 4=I drink a little more; 5=I drink a lot more

ElementDescription: Visit name
Personal alcohol use before versus during the pandemic
Notes: 1 = I have been drinking alcohol more now than I did before the pandemic; 2 = I have been drinking alcohol less now than I did before the pandemic; 3 = I have been drinking alcohol the same amount now as I did before the pandemic; 9998 = Do not what to answer. Asked to study subjects who answered 1 to ''First drink of alcohol during pandemic''

ElementDescription: Days had one or more drinks of alcohol in the past 30 days
Notes: Asked to those who drink

ElementDescription: Largest number of drinks in a single day in the past 30 days
Notes: 0 = I haven''t had a drink in the past 30 days; 1 = 1-2 drinks; 2 = 3-4 drinks; 3 = 5-7 drinks; 4 = 8-11 drinks; 5 = 12-23 drinks; 6 = 24 or more drinks; 9998 = Do not to answer. Asked to those who drank 1 day or more or do not want to answer

ElementDescription: On the days that the study subject did drink alcohol in the past 30 days, usual number of drinks each day
Notes: Asked to those who drank 1 day or more or do not want to answer

ElementDescription: On the days that the study subject did drink alcohol in the past 30 days, usual number of drinks each day with school the next day
Notes: Asked to those who drank 1 day or more or do not want to answer

ElementDescription: On the days that the study subject did drink alcohol in the past 30 days, usual number of drinks each day without school the next day
Notes: Asked to those who drank 1 day or more or do not want to answer

ElementDescription: Number of days in the past 30 days the study subject had (if assigned female at birth (AFAB) or intersex, or blank, insert: 3; if assigned male at birth (AMAB) and 14-15 years of age, insert: 4; if assigned male at birth (AMAB) and 16-17 years of age, insert: 5) or more drinks of alcohol in a 2-hour period
Notes: Asked to those who drank 1 day or more or do not want to answer

ElementDescription: Drinking by yourself versus with other people in the past 30 days
Notes: 1 = 100% by yourself; 5 = 50% by yourself, 50% with other people; 10 = 100% with other people. Asked to those who drank 1 day or more or do not want to answer

ElementDescription: Drinking in-person versus virtually in the past 30 days
Notes: 1 = 100% virtual; 5 = 50% virtual, 50% in person; 10 = 100% in person. Asked to those who answered greater than or equal to 2 in Alcohol_use_30days_Social

ElementDescription: Typical student alcohol use
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Less than a few times a year; 3 = A few times a year; 4 = Once or twice a month; 5 = Once or twice a week; 6 = Every day / almost every day; 9998 = Do not want to answer

ElementDescription: Closest friends alcohol use
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Less than a few times a year; 3 = A few times a year; 4 = Once or twice a month; 5 = Once or twice a week; 6 = Every day / almost every day; 9998 = Do not want to answer

ElementDescription: Personal alcohol use
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Monthly or less often; 3 = 2-4 times a month; 4 = 2-3 times a week; 5 = 4 or more times a week; 9998 = Do not want to answer

ElementDescription: Amount of alcoholic drinks on a typical day
Notes: 1 = 0 drinks; 2 = 1 to 2 drinks; 3 = 3 to 4 drinks; 4 = 5 to 6 drinks; 5 = 7 to 9 drinks; 6 = 10 or more; 9998 = Do not want to answer

ElementDescription: How often do you have six or more drinks on one occasion?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Less than monthly; 2= Monthly; 3= Weekly; 4= Daily or almost daily; 5= N/A; 9999= no data; 444= Do not wish to respond; 999= No Answer; 888= Skipped; 777= Condition Skipped; 555= Missing

ElementDescription: Age of first drink
Notes: 0 = 8 years old or younger; 1 = 9 years old; 2 = 10 years old; 3 = 11 years old; 4 = 12 years old; 5 = 13 years old; 6 = 14 years old; 7 = 15 years old; 8 = 16 years old; 9 = 17 years old; 9998 = Do not want to answer. If answered 2::5;9998 to personal alcohol use

ElementDescription: First drink of alcohol during pandemic
Notes: 1 = No, I drank alcohol before the pandemic started (we mean, before March 13, 2020); 2 = Yes, I had my first drink of alcohol during the height of the pandemic (we mean, between March 2020 and September 2021); 3 = Yes, I had my first drink of alcohol recently (we mean, September, 2021 or more recent); 9998 = Do not want to answer. Asked to those who drink.
